titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of her papers at Syracuse University

list.item: 12 Dec 2018 - all accessions combined and entire collection processed and rehoused (PRB)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Papers of the American sculptor, including original artwork and reproductions, correspondence and memorabilia as well as some family history of both Frishmuth and her longtime companion Ruth Talcott.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Harriet W. Frishmuth (1880-1980) was an American sculptor. Born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, on September 17, 1880, she studied art in Paris under Rodin and Injalbert, in Berlin under Euchteitz and at the Art Students' League under Borglum and McNeil, where she was awarded the St. Gaudens first prize. Her work has been exhibited at the National Academy of Design, the Academy of Fine Arts in Philadelphia, the Salon in Paris, the San Francisco Exposition (1939-1940) and the National Association of Women Painters and Sculptors.

Frishmuth received several awards from the National Academy of Design, a prize from the Grand Central Art Galleries, an honorable mention from the San Francisco Exposition and the Joan of Arc Silver Medal from the National Association of Women Painters and Sculptors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Harriet Whitney Frishmuth Papers consists of artwork originals and reproductions, audiovisual material, biographical material, correspondence subject files, financial and legal material, memorabilia and writings.
Artwork originals includes plaster and bronze models of her sculpture as well as sketches and paintings.
Artwork reproductions consists of a fairly complete photographic record of Ms. Frishmuth's work.
Audiovisual material includes audiotapes and a transcript of reminiscences compiled for an article in The Courier (1971) and amateur films of vacation trips.
Biographical material is some short biographical sketches and obituaries.
Correspondence-subject files include both personal and business correspondence as well as information on various galleries and organizations with which Ms. Frishmuth was associated.
Financial and legal material includes records of sales and foundry orders as well as copyright certificates and tax returns.

Memorabilia includes a caricature of Harriet Frishmuth by Matias Santoyo, awards and certficates, catalogs of shows and galleries, clipppings, photographs, postcards from vacations, printed material scrapbooks of family history and Ms. Frishmuth's sculpture and miscellaneous souvenirs.
Writings contains two vacation diaries and an essay.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The Harriet Whitney Frishmuth Papers are arranged by category of material and alphabetically within each category.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has the papers of more than 60 sculptors, including Anna Hyatt Huntington, James Earle Fraser and his wife Laura Gardin Fraser, and Brenda Putnam. Please see &subjindex; for a complete listing.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: A few books have been removed from the collection and transferred to Rare Books for separate cataloging.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Nothing in the round (i.e. three-dimensional) may be reproduced. This includes medals.
Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Majority of collection gift of Harriet Frishmuth, 1967-1980.
Some memorabilia gift of Ruth Talcott, 1985.
"Dorothea" bronze relief and plaster relief, and plaster bust of infant gift of Bettina Huffman, 2010.

Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Scenes from trips in Stockholm, Sweden and Helsinki, Finland, also depicts Alexander II (Romanov) monument on the Senate Square in Helsinki, other statues and a graveyard. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

did.unittitle: Åndalsnes to Meråker via Geirangerfjord (3 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Scenes from trips in Norway. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it, some illegible, or faded text.
An amateur film of Miss Frishmuth's trips to Curacao and Jamaica. Depicts street views, harbors, markets, landscape, Miss Frishmuth in various scenes, sailors, boats.

did.unittitle: Delft Holland: Market; Edam cheese 80K; Poultry plant; Dum hang hare [?]; Bagpipers; Dasein - Tumth [?]; Luncheon train; Hilversum (12 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Depicts scenes from Netherlands cities, Royal Palace, buildings, landscape. Illegible text on the label. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Scenes from trips in Denmark, Kronborg castle, Fredensborg Palace, buildings. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

did.unittitle: Denmark: Island of Bornholm; Østerlars round church; Iced hjecu [?] smoked herring (6 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Scenes from trips in Denmark, depicting windmills, the Little Mermaid statue, street market, clay crafting, buildings architecture. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

did.unittitle: Hamburg City; Residential; Harbor and Piers; leaving Hamburg (11 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Depicts scenes from Hamburg, Germany, monuments, buildings, city streets. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

Film reel, depicting scenes of Miss Frishmuth in front of various sculptures; Miss Frishmuth knitting, accompanied by her dog; Miss Frishmuth looking at a book; Miss Frishmuth writing on her desk. The film is accompanied by an old label and a typed note. The note reads: "This movie was taken in 1936 in Miss Frishmuth's studio in Sniffen Court in New York City".

did.unittitle: Ireland: Killarney; Halse Country [?]; Exit from Glasgow [?] (13 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Depicts scenes from Ireland, England and Scotland trips, pigs on a street, various carriages, horse riding demonstrations, trip on a boat. Illegible text on the label. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Depicts scenes from Leningrad, Russia, city architecture, St. Isaac's Cathedral, Hermitage Museum, General Staff Building. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

did.unittitle: Leningrad of Pier; Kiev Council House [?]; Lock -[?] being locked in (10 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Depicts scenes from Leningrad, harbors, sailing ships, helicopter, pier. The label has illegible notes. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.

Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Depicts scenes from Leningrad, Pushkin,city architecture, outdoor stadium. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.
An amateur film of a Lipizzans demonstration, Spanish Riding School in a closed arena. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.
An amateur film depicting a man diving from a boat, street views, people working on a field, harbors. (Might be an additional film related to the trip to Curacao and Jamaica).

did.unittitle: Midnight Scene; Lofoten Islands; Svartisen glacier; Train trip Rondalsbekken [?] (2 of 13)
did.abstract: Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Scenes from trips on a boat or with a train in Norway. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.
Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.
Part of series of amateur films of Miss Frishmuth's trip around Europe. Scenes from trips around Norway and Sweden. Accompanied by a piece of a Kodakchrome box with handwritten labels on it.
An amateur film depicting a shore view, landscape, boats, buildings, Miss Frishmuth by a bird house with a dog.
